text: General elections were held in Sweden on 15 September 1940.Nohlen, D & Stöver, P (2010) Elections in Europe: A data handbook, p1858 The Swedish Social Democratic Party remained the largest party, winning 134 of the 230 seats in the Second Chamber of the Riksdag.Nohlen & Stöver, p1872 It is one of two general elections in Swedish history where a single party received more than half of the vote (the other occasion being 1968). ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right |- |colspan=7|300px |- !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Social Democratic Party||1,546,804||53.8||134||+22 |- |align=left|National Organisation of the Right||518,346||18.0||42||–2 |- |align=left|Farmers' League||344,345||12.0||28||–8 |- |align=left|People's Party||344,113||12.0||23||–4 |- |align=left|Communist Party||101,424||3.5||3||–2 |- |align=left|Socialist Party||18,430||0.6||0||–6 |- |align=left|Other parties||955||0.0||0||0 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||14,720||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||2,889,137||100||230||0 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||4,110,720||70.3||–||– |- |align=left colspan=5|Source: Nohlen & Stöver |} ==References== 1940 Swedish general election General election Swedish general election
title: 1940 Swedish general election
